title.value: Assessing the inclusion of children’s surgical care in National Surgical, Obstetric and Anaesthesia Plans: a policy content analysis
title.justification: The title of the paper is extracted from the provided text.
title.quote: Wimmer S, et al. Assessing the inclusion of children’s surgical care in National Surgical, Obstetric and Anaesthesia Plans: a policy content analysis

extractions.description: This paper aims to assess how children's surgical care is included in National Surgical, Obstetric and Anaesthesia Plans (NSOAPs) in low/middle-income countries. The study develops a framework based on the Global Initiative for Children's Surgery’s Optimal Resources for Children’s Surgery (OReCS) document and applies this framework to analyze the NSOAPs of Ethiopia, Nigeria, Rwanda, Senegal, Tanzania, and Zambia. The paper identifies the extent to which children's surgical care is addressed and provides recommendations for future policies.

type.justification: The paper focuses on developing a framework and analyzing policy documents, which is a theoretical approach rather than empirical research.
type.quote: We performed two qualitative content analyses to assess the inclusion of children’s surgical care among NSOAPs.

name.justification: The primary focus of the paper is on assessing and recommending policies for children's surgical care within national healthcare plans.
name.quote: This study aims to assess the inclusion of children’s surgical care among existing NSOAPs, identify practice examples and provide recommendations to guide inclusion of children’s surgical care in future policies.

aliases: Health Policy Analysis, Surgical Healthcare Policy, Children's Surgical Policy

name.justification: The paper has a significant focus on global health issues, particularly in low/middle-income countries.
name.quote: NSOAPs have emerged as a strategy to strengthen and scale up surgical healthcare systems in low/middle-income countries (LMICs).

name.justification: The focus of the paper is specifically on surgical care for children within national healthcare plans.
name.quote: Additional focus must be placed on the development of surgical healthcare systems for children in LMICs.
